materials.name: human iPS cells
materials.details: CAG::Cas9;Dlxi1/2b::eGFP cell line, parental line: 1205-4, derived at Stanford University, validated by pluripotency assays and genome integrity

materials.name: pooled lentivirus library
materials.details: Five sgRNAs per gene targeting 438 genes of interest plus 10% negative control sgRNAs; vector: pMCB320 (Addgene cat. no. 89359); expressed: sgRNA and mCherry

params.note: All cultures should be regularly monitored for bacterial, mycoplasma and fungal contamination.
Perform quality-control experiments to verify patterning and specification by using qPCRs for brain region–specific genes.
Examine the experimental framework for modeling with organoids and assembloids that was outlined as part of a consensus effort27.
Validation of candidate genes from the KO screen involves generation of isogenic KO hiPS cell lines and their neural differentiation.
CRISPR–Cas9–based strategy used: Synthego’s gene KO kit designs three sgRNAs per candidate gene to induce concurrent double-strand breaks.

params.program: optimized nucleofection protocol for delivery of sgRNAs and Cas9 protein into hiPS cells

params.note: KO cell pool generated with high proportion of KO cells for targeted gene used to validate specific phenotypes.
Successful execution requires expertise in hiPS cell culture, differentiation into regionalized neural organoids, and integration into assembloids.
Experience required with lentiviral production and transduction, genetic engineering of hiPS cell lines (e.g., knock-in reporters or Cas9 expression), and large-scale pooled library delivery.
Expertise required in fluorescence-activated cell sorting (FACS).
Downstream workflows require extraction and processing of genomic DNA from organoids, sample preparation for next-generation sequencing (NGS), and computational analysis for sgRNA enrichment.
Experiments using hiPS cells approved by Stanford University School of Medicine Institutional Review Board and Stem Cell Research Oversight.
Check cell lines regularly to ensure authenticity and absence of mycoplasma infection.
Lentivirus is biosafety level 2 or higher material; handle according to institutional safety regulations.
